titleStmt.title: By the Queene, the Quenes Maiestie callyng to her good remembraunce howe well thys realme is furnished with good lawes and orders, for redresse of many enormities ...
Proclamations. 1562-05-07
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1558-1603 : Elizabeth I)

publicationStmt.publisher: in Powles Church yarde by Rycharde Jugge and John Cawood, printers to the Quenes Maiestie,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and first lines of text.
Proclamation requiring observation of statutes on apparell and the decay of horses.
At foot of sheet 2: Cum priuilegio Regiæ Maiestatis.
Dated at end: Yeven at her Maiesties pallaice of Westminster the. vii. of May, the fourth yere of her hyghnes raigne.
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
